column4: Pentagon sees risk in F-35 fighter's complex logistics program
column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Md. Long delays in Lockheed Martin Corp's development of a computer-based logistics system for the F-35 fighter jet pose the biggest threat to the U.S. Air Force's plan to declare the aircraft ready for combat next summer  the head of the Pentagon's F-35 program office said.

column4: UPDATE 3-Lilly diabetes drug slashes deaths in patients with heart risk
column5: Sept 17 Eli Lilly and Co's new Jardiance pill slashed deaths by 32 percent in patients with type 2 diabetes at risk of heart attack and stroke  a finding that could make it a mainstay diabetes treatment and triple its use  according to researchers and analysts.

column4: Advaxis therapy improves survival rates in cervical cancer patients
column5: Advaxis Inc said its experimental cancer vaccine was found more effective in improving survival rates of cervical cancer patients than standard therapy  validating the technology behind its pipeline of cancer treatments.

column5: Sept 17 Investment bank Jefferies said quarterly adjusted net earnings fell by nearly half after concerns over the slowing Chinese economy and the Greek debt crisis cut into trading volume and forced a writedown of assets.

column4: CORRECTED-Under Armour expects revenue to more than double by 2018 (Sept. 16)
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 16 Athletic wear maker Under Armour Inc said on Wednesday it expects to more than double revenues and build more than 800 stores outside North America by 2018 as it takes on bigger rival Nike Inc in the highly competitive athletic gear market.

column4: NASA could have cut costs after botched Orbital launch: watchdog
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla. NASA missed opportunities to save millions of dollars following Orbital ATK’s failed cargo run to the International Space Station last year  the agency’s top watchdog said on Thursday.
